value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">9</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">exhort <quote source="#" rend="inline">"God keep us sound in the faith and send us health</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">and a care to please God above all"</quote> Or to admonish---</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>"Be not speedy of speech, nor talk suddenly, but where</l>
            <l>discretion requireth, and that soberly then....</l>
            <l>Let not Lawson, that fox, be 
              <choice>
                <sic>acqaunited</sic>
                <corr>acquainted</corr>
              </choice> with my letters..."</l>
          </quote>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Fear of man, fear of God surround them as h as with the 
            <choice>
              <sic>wallsof</sic>
              <corr>walls of</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a dungeon. There is no gaiety, no freedom, no 
            <choice>
              <sic>familairity</sic>
              <corr>familiarity</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>ni</sic>
              <corr>in</corr>
            </choice> the 
            <choice>
              <sic>hose</sic>
              <corr>house</corr>
            </choice> she lives in. The sound of the Bible is in her</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>wars</sic>
              <corr>words</corr>
            </choice>. Her prose takes its 
            <choice>
              <sic>slolemn</sic>
              <corr>solemn</corr>
            </choice> strain. And the prose</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of the bible will not adapt itself to the 
            <choice>
              <sic>eaxy</sic>
              <corr>easy</corr>
            </choice>, the 
            <choice>
              <sic>co  oqu</sic>
              <corr>colloquial</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is a garment to be put on when the mind is erect and</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">dignified, on state 
            <choice>
              <sic>oaccions</sic>
              <corr>occasions</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It is because they use of the prose of the bible when</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">they write prose that the Elizabethans are unknown to us.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It They can say nothing 
            <choice>
              <sic>simle</sic>
              <corr>simple</corr>
            </choice>, nothing intimate.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They are 
            <choice>
              <sic>nevr</sic>
              <corr>never</corr>
            </choice> subtle; they are never shaded. Bright 
            <choice>
              <sic>contrastd</sic>
              <corr>contrasted</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">colours meet on their faces. Carnation and 
            <choice>
              <sic>sanow</sic>
              <corr>snow</corr>
            </choice>;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">ebony and gold. When we look at them we see them</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in their 
            <choice>
              <sic>farthibgales</sic>
              <corr>farthingales</corr>
            </choice> and 
            <choice>
              <sic>ru ffs</sic>
              <corr>ruffs</corr>
            </choice>;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">young 
            <choice>
              <sic>men s</sic>
              <corr>men's</corr>
            </choice> bodies</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">are stiffly sewn into 
            <choice>
              <sic>dohblets</sic>
              <corr>doublets</corr>
            </choice> and school boys faces</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">are raised above starched collars; 
            <choice>
              <sic>yong</sic>
              <corr>young</corr>
            </choice> women serve only to s</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">display heavy quilted 
            <choice>
              <sic>dresse</sic>
              <corr>dresses</corr>
            </choice> stuck about with huge pearls.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The writer, 
            <choice>
              <sic>to  rds</sic>
              <corr>towards</corr>
            </choice> the end of the 
            <choice>
              <sic>sicteenth cnyury</sic>
              <corr>sixteenth century</corr>
            </choice>,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">was separate from his 
            <choice>
              <sic>arudience</sic>
              <corr>audience</corr>
            </choice>; but he was still closely</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">connected with it. He was himself unspecialised, 
            <choice>
              <sic>un ifferent</sic>
              <corr>undifferentiated</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">ated. His eye was stimulated by the crimsons and gold and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">greens of the clothing. His ear was stimulated by the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sound of words For 
            <choice>
              <sic>  ac </sic>
              <corr>each</corr>
            </choice> word was given substance and sharpness</l>
